PIVOTAL FIELD OPERATIONS A Message from Greg Stroud OCTOBER 2015 SALES NEWS FLASH Global Field Sales Team,
As we enter Q4, we need everyone focused on getting Q4 business in. That said, please take a moment to read this communication carefully as there are operational & product updates that you should be aware of.
Pivotal’s New Webex & Conferencing. Action Needed. This is a reminder that beginning on October 26, 2015 your existing EMC conferencing service (WebEx) will switch to a new Pivotal-branded experience. Within the next couple of days you will receive a welcome email from the service provider, BT, containing your new account details, which you may begin using immediately. Please be sure to update any scheduled or recurring calls with your new account details. Please note, as a part of the switch, your existing WebEx and Audio account through EMC will be closed down on November 30, 2015. More information, including new Global Access Numbers may be found on the Pivotal Conferencing Services page here <https://sites.google.com/a/pivotal.io/pivotal-it/pivotal-conferencing?pli=1>.
Save the Date—2016 WWKO is coming back to SF Pivotal’s World Wide Kickoff (WWKO) will be returning to San Francisco, taking place Monday January 25 through Thursday January 28th at the Marriott Marquis Hotel right in downtown near the Moscone Center. Stay tuned for more information and look out for the official invitation in upcoming weeks. Have a question on the event? Send a note to company-kick-off-2016@pivotal.io <mailto:company-kick-off-2016@pivotal.io>.
Still Time to Make the Subscription Club! There is still time to be a top subscription producer in the 2H of FY15! As a reminder, Sales Reps/Managers who achieve their 2H Product quota threshold with >90% being Subscription and Data Sales Reps/Managers who achieve their 2H Product quota threshold with >90% being BDS will attend a fun, celebratory company event, May 21–24 2016, at the W Hotel <http://info.pivotal.io/CUp00H0qN2rI0ACP2N0dJ0e> in South Beach, Miami, Florida! FEs nominated by their GEO lead will also attend. Full SPIF details are available here <https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1wvQMdbt3UfpMsXpiJRnTk8Fl0dZYHekIJsAAKZVdt_M/edit#slide=id.gcfda230d0_0_27> and you can view the latest leaderboard, as of October 26th here <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1PDl8mwB87lJjvzcXQ6-DKr6-PANVXyeUa3hriekilPs/edit#gid=1173639275>.
As a reminder, we have a 8 SPIFs running through the end of the year, full details here <https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1wvQMdbt3UfpMsXpiJRnTk8Fl0dZYHekIJsAAKZVdt_M/edit#slide=id.gcfda230d0_0_0>.
New—Compensation Corner Quarterly Communication Sales Commissions is now sending out a quarterly communication that highlights what’s new, what you need to know, and most frequently asked questions related to Compensation & Commissions. Missed the email? You may view it here <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1mj9SgF-otY5dsVgN4EaUjEpeLCrIa-FfJp-QelpcnTc/edit>.
Sales Play Rollout Many of you have now heard about "the Play," which is Pivotal’s latest and most effective approach to selling Pivotal Cloud Foundry. Content has been put together that is based on a sales process that was tried and refined over the last 6 months in the trenches at Verizon, Comcast, Dish Network and many, many other accounts. On the PCF Sales Play <https://sites.google.com/a/pivotal.io/inside-pivotal-cf/pcf-sales-plays> site, you will find a series of assets to help you execute the play. Assume this content will evolve as we collectively learn more about our customers, their needs and the best way to communicate the value of our products and services.
Introducing: On the Road with Bill Cook Podcast Series We are thrilled that Bill Cook will be hosting a new series of insightful, informal chats with reps, field engineers and other key product leaders to deliver timely and relevant updates and stories from the road. The series kicks off with two new podcast episodes, available here and on the Field Operations Inside Pivotal Page <https://sites.google.com/a/pivotal.io/inside-pivotal/departments/global_field-operations>.
New Podcasts What a Great 3rd Quarter <http://www.drivetunes.org/app/?state={%22ids%22:%5B%220Bz8zpYijd4oxcXBoWl9IdENZM2c%22%5D,%22action%22:%22open%22,%22userId%22:%22113028924716591788465%22}#/selected/> with Bill Cook and Andy O’Brien and few of his sales leaders in the US.
Latest Play for PCF and Driving Digital Transformation Into the Install Base <http://www.drivetunes.org/app/?state={%22ids%22:%5B%220Bz8zpYijd4oxX1ltVFlYZDZHalU%22%5D,%22action%22:%22open%22,%22userId%22:%22113028924716591788465%22}#/selected/> with Bill Cook, Ian Andrews, Andrew Ettinger and Raghvender Arni.
Product Updates Reminder: Big Data Suite, Flex Hadoop Edition If your customer already has Hortonworks HDP and does not require Pivotal Hadoop distribution (PHD), then sell your customer Pivotal Big Data Suite, Flex Hadoop Edition.Flex Hadoop Edition includes the same entitlements as the standard BDS, but without PHD. The Flex Hadoop Edition has been specifically designed for customers who are using a non-Pivotal Hadoop distribution, such as Hortonworks. Selling PHD in this case would be duplication and would add unnecessary costs to Pivotal.
HAWQ and MADlib OSS Effective September 29, 2015, Pivotal released its Open Source versions of HAWQ and MADlib through The Apache Foundation. This version is currently incubating here <http://hawq.incubator.apache.org/> for HAWQ and here <http://madlib.incubator.apache.org> for MADlib.
In addition, the commercial version of HAWQ has been renamed to “Pivotal HDB” and will continue to be provided and supported through Pivotal Big Data Suite. We will update the various systems and tools (MPL, Product Guide, SKUs, Zendesk, etc) very soon. For more information about Pivotal newest OSS product and what it means for our commercial version, please consult our internal FAQ <https://docs.google.com/document/d/13FptFyRzz3N-ldyJZSgmGwNN1a6E1YrbHN4JNj25yuU/edit?ts=562027b1>.
PCF 1.6 GA end of October PCF 1.6 is forecasting a GA release on October 23rd. New releases will be found on PivNet for Ops Manager, Elastic Runtime and the services in the PCF Suite (Gemfire SSC, RabbitMQ, Redis, MySQL and Ops Metrics). New features include:
- .net support - New Diego-based app scheduling replacing DEAs - Docker support
Should you have any questions, please contact pcf-concierge@pivotal.io <http://info.pivotal.io/z09d2CN000oUARicID40J00>.
Spring Cloud Services for Pivotal Cloud Foundry Spring Cloud Services for PCF launched on October 24. It is a collection of services that enable the use of cloud-native distributed systems patterns for Spring Boot applications deployed to PCF. These services represent the first enterprise-ready, turnkey distribution of the Netflix OSS stack, and include:
- Configuration Server - Service Registry (powered by Netflix Eureka) - Circuit Breaker Dashboard (powered by Netflix Hystrix and Turbine)
Spring Cloud Services will be entitled as part of PCF Elastic Runtime and will use Application Instances. Please consult the Pivotal Product Guide <https://d1fto35gcfffzn.cloudfront.net/legal/Pivotal-Product-Guide-v.17.pdf> or Pivotal Master Price List <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/12s_pcDR7RgGUimOjLm72RaVxrJ5amYhd_Begd9hBkeY/edit#gid=1454657096> for specific details on counting AIs.
Sales Regional Review Schedule Starting October 27th, Bill Cook will begin a regional-review tour and will be stopping by a city near you! First up is the Americas, kicking off October 27th and continuing through November 17th in EMEA. APJ stops will include Sydney, South Asia, China, Japan and Korea—stay tuned for the dates & schedule, which will be available in the November Operations Newsletter.
Be Bold! Greg
